summary:
I am an experienced Process Engineering Professional with a demonstrated portfolio of working within the Global Diaspora of the Oil & Gas Industry,  Performance Chemicals, Paper/ Pulp and Research. I am widely regarded as highly skilled at Plant Technical Support , Process Optimization/ Modelling and Troubleshooting your Operating units as well as Process Design (FEED), Plant Commissioning,  and Process Safety.  Learned industry techniques/stds for fire/explosion risk assessments in the oil & gas sector across geographies and have established myself as a future multi-industry expert.

My knowledge on a wide range of technologies stems from the innate quality of curiosity that has thus far made for an exciting and often quirky engineering career.

I  am a strong engineering professional who holds a Bachelor's Degree  in Chemical Engineering from University of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. And, I am unabashedly proud of my heritage and humble beginnings. 

With over 16 years of experience in the engineering and specialist chemical sector and refining in the fields of Plant Technical Support, Troubleshooting, Project management & execution, Process Hazard Analysis, Biochemical Engineering, including Research and Development in the Paper and Pulp Industry.. I realize the field of engineering is a passion I get to live everyday.  I am not done yet. 

*Currently employed as a consulting engineer in Front End Design and Process Safety within the Netherlands.  

Special Value – I combine my  strong academic base with natural leadership, analytical and communication skills to help deliver better, quicker, cost effective solutions to business while ensuring the sustained performance of plant, processes and people with respect to safety. A bit of a mouthful. As a quick charismatic thinker, I am  unafraid of new challenges while  I draw energy from working with and developing people into assets to the business.  I am wholly committed to safety, and passionate about  engineering and people.

My journey has immensely benefited from the guidance of great technical and personal coaches and this has ignited a spark to coaching and mentoring the next generation of engineering leaders in the same way that my life has been the better for. 
My zest for my profession is part Kaizen, and part stubbornness and a love of MacGyver. 

Let's start a dialogue and a revolution where y = mx + c and pi can be firm friends.  

One molecule at a time

awards.title: Managing Director Award : Process Engineering Support (ATAR plant)
awards.description:
For resolving inherent color issues since 1980s on Phenol  streams from E1909 Distillation Column. This resulted in stable saleable material with zero customer complaints for Phenolic Resins and Fertiliser end users and improved business relabilty. the resolution was reached by solid process  engineering and chemistry understanding and complex Super fractionation resulting in new ways of working with the Operations Teams. No capital was used to address the long standing concern on 50% of the Depitched Tar Acid Value Chain. 

The operating philosophy and OWAP of S1900 also improved stability of the upstream  N Base Unit and downstream Cresol Plants resulting in no downtime or reworking of off-specification material.

Awarded by :  Mr Ahmed Karachi, Merisol, Managing Director -
Seconded by : Mr Pieter Mattheus, Technical Manager, Merisol

awards.title: Managing Director Award : Best Safety observer
awards.description:
For being the best Behaviour Based Safety Observor across all disciplines of Merisol. This reduced near misses on occupational safety and highlighted and addressed a number of engineering controls that could be improved to reduce risk to plant people and the process. Krishni used her strong engineering background to consistently for 8 of the 12 months of the Fiscal Year deliver the strongest observations as vetoed by the SHERQ (Safety Health Environmental Responsible Care and quality) Department and topped our year end awards. She won both a cash award and Sasol Certificate

Awarded by : Mr Ahmed Karachi, Managing Director - Merisol
